page.title: 01PAVENHAM
page.content:
The village of Pavenham has very successfully resisted pressures of development to which other similar and nearby places have succumbed. Most of the village has been designated a Conservation Area.
The church stands slightly to the north of the older part of the village on higher ground. It has a 14th century spire and some 14th and 15th century work in the main body of the building. The original building was begun in the 13th century but not much of this remains.
Agriculture was for many years the main occupation with straw plaiting and rush gathering later additions. Today, as with many other village in the area, most people travel to nearby towns to work.
